headline.main: FRANCE.; Chromatopsendopsit--The Use and Abuse of Stays--Suicide among Dogs--Compressed Air as a Motor--A Frenchman in America--The Departmental Governments--Silk-worms their own Dyers--Rapping Phenomena in Germany--Theatricals Music, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Colored signals have for some time been used upon French railroads, as a means of acquainting the engineers of approaching trains with the state of the track, during the night. Each guardian has three bull's-eye lanterns, one white, one green, and one red.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: Proximity of the Lobos Islands to Farmers and Citizens.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: It is a mistaken notion to ascribe the bad effects resulting from crowded assemblies in illventilated rooms to a deficiency of oxygen gas and superabundance of carbonic acid, although more of the latter than usual is probably present; yet chemical analysis shows that there is as much oxygen as in the open air; there are always cracks and crevices through which it will intrude.

headline.main: MORAL AND RELIGIOUS.; Church and Missionary Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The friends of the Union Theological Seminary will be glad to learn that the sum of One Hundred Thousand Dollars has finally been secured toward the proposed Fund for the complete endowment of the Institution. This amount, however, is not all that will be necessary for the attainment of the objects of the Seminary.

docs.lead_paragraph: TO THE PUBLIC.--I feel it a duty I owe to those who are suffering under the severe affliction of throat and lung complaints, to bear this unsought testimony to the superior skill and beneficial effects of Dr. LUTENER'S treatment, lately introduced into this country by the discoverer, Dr. LUTENER, an English physician of high reputation.

docs.lead_paragraph: General SCOTT arrived here last evening in good health. The members of the Board of Commissioners upon the Military Asylum are all here, except Gen. GIBSON, who is expected to-night. Owing to his absence, it is understood nothing was done today.
docs.snippet: General SCOTT arrived here last evening in good health. The members of the Board of Commissioners upon the Military Asylum are all here, except Gen. GIBSON, who is expected to-night. Owing to his absence, it is understood nothing was done today.

headline.main: ENGLAND.; The Budget and the Ministry--Position of Mr. Gladstone--His Favorable Reception --Jewish Disabilities-International Post. age--The Times's Attack on Kossuth--Kossuth's Exculpation-Mrs. Stowe--Charitable Subscriptions--Amusements.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Budget is out at last,--after being delayed as long as it decently could, doubtless in order to enable the ABERDEEN Cabinet to arrange its plans and consolidate the some what heterogeneous materials of which it is composed before settling down seriously to facts and figures.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: Having finished all their work, concluded their appointed labors, and adjourned sine die, the Association set "a thousand strong" at Metropolitan Hall, to partake of the great feast spread for them by their New-York brethren. Grace was said by Rev. Dr. KREBS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Aldermen In Session. On Wednesday night, at the meeting of the Aldermen, R. T. COMPTON, President, was in the Chair. A quorum present. CORNER GROCERIES. Alderman TIEMAN rose and moved the reading of a message which he understood had been received from his Honor the Mayor.

headline.main: JERSEY CITY.; THE BOARD OF ALDERMEN.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE BOARD OF ALDERMEN.-The Board met at 8 o'clock on Tuesday evening, at the Lyceum, pursuant to adjournment the previous evening. The President of the Board, Aldernan T. B. BETTS in the Chair. There was a full board. The President announced the appointment of the following Standing Committees for the ensuing year: Finance.-Aldermen James, Miller, and Lyon.

headline.main: HAVANA.; Arrival of the Empire City.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamship Empire City, Capt. WINDLE, arrived yesterday morning from New-Orleans and Havana, bringing dates from the latter port to the 29th ult. On the 2d inst., in lat. 33[Degrees] 11', long. 76?? 40', the Empire City passed a bark showing a blue, white and red signal, with letter D in the centre, bound North.
